intro: Piper perijaense, commonly known as the Perijá pepper, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the humid montane forests of northern South America, specifically in Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing vines and small, heart-shaped leaves. Its fruits are clustered in dense spikes and contain tiny, peppercorn-like seeds. Piper perijaense is valued for its unique flavor and is used in traditional medicine and as a spice in local cuisines.
